So for my news, there's a new study by researchers at Northwestern University, Harvard University

racism may have decreased modestly.
And so they look at these two kinds of experiments.
There's a resume and there's the in-person audits.
In the first, researchers send out resumes with similar levels of education, experience,
so on.
And the names differ so that the resumes have a stereotypically black or Latino name and
others have a stereotypically white name.
This is an experiment that's been done in social science over and over and over, and

And in the second, applicants go in person to apply for a job.

experience levels.

What they concluded on average with taking all these studies together is that white

white applicants receive on average 24% more callbacks than Latinos.
For my social science methodologists out there, the researchers deployed a range of controls
to verify their research.
They measured outcomes in different ways controlling for socioeconomic status, for geography, for

of a reduction in hiring discrimination against African Americans over time.
